items.name: Apply Performance Pack (All)
items.description: Applies the full integrated performance pack. Keeps Windows/driver update services intact.

steps.command: reg add "HKCU\Control Panel\Accessibility\Keyboard Response" /v Flags /t REG_SZ /d "122" /f >nul 2>&1
reg add "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\Memory Management" /v ClearPageFileAtShutdown /t REG_DWORD /d "0" /f >nul 2>&1
netsh interface teredo set state disabled >nul 2>&1
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\Windows Error Reporting" /v Disabled /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f >nul 2>&1
sc config "Intel(R) TPM Provisioning Service" start=disabled >nul 2>&1
sc config "Intel(R) Platform License Manager Service" start=disabled >nul 2>&1
sc config "Intel(R) Capability Licensing Service TCP IP Interface" start=disabled >nul 2>&1
sc config "Intel(R) SUR QC SAM" start=disabled >nul 2>&1
reg add "HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\AMD Crash Defender Service" /v "Start" /t REG_DWORD /d "4" /f >nul 2>&1
reg add "HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\AMD External Events Utility" /v "Start" /t REG_DWORD /d "4" /f >nul 2>&1
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\ApplicationFrameHost.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\csrss.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "4" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\csrss.exe\PerfOptions" /v "IoPriority" /t REG_DWORD /d "3" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\dllhost.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\dwm.exe\PerfOptions" /v "IoPriority" /t REG_DWORD /d "3" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\fontdrvhost.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\lsass.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\lsass.exe\PerfOptions" /v "IoPriority" /t REG_DWORD /d "0" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\lsass.exe\PerfOptions" /v "PagePriority" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\SearchIndexer.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\SearchIndexer.exe\PerfOptions" /v "IoPriority" /t REG_DWORD /d "0" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\services.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\sihost.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\smss.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\StartMenu.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\svchost.exe" /v "MinimumStackCommitInBytes" /t REG_DWORD /d "32768" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\svchost.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\svchost.exe\PerfOptions" /v "IoPriority" /t REG_DWORD /d "0" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\TrustedInstaller.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\TrustedInstaller.exe\PerfOptions" /v "IoPriority" /t REG_DWORD /d "0" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\wininit.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\winlogon.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\WMIADAP.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\WmiPrvSE.exe\PerfOptions" /v "CpuPriorityClass" /t REG_DWORD /d "1" /f

items.name: Apply: Misc
items.description: Applies the Misc subset from the integrated performance pack.

items.name: Apply: Services / Tasks
items.description: Applies the Services / Tasks subset from the integrated performance pack.

steps.command: sc config "Intel(R) TPM Provisioning Service" start=disabled >nul 2>&1
sc config "Intel(R) Platform License Manager Service" start=disabled >nul 2>&1
sc config "Intel(R) SUR QC SAM" start=disabled >nul 2>&1

items.name: Apply: Boot / Timer
items.description: Applies the Boot / Timer subset from the integrated performance pack.

items.name: Apply: Power
items.description: Applies the Power subset from the integrated performance pack.

items.name: Disable All Notifications
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables toast notifications.

items.name: Disable Animations
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables UI animations.

items.name: Disable Bluetooth Services
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Stops and disables Bluetooth service.

items.name: Disable Driver Searching
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Prevents Windows from searching Windows Update for drivers.

items.name: Disable Experimental Features
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables preview/experimental features via policy.

items.name: Disable GameDVR
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Xbox Game Bar capture/GameDVR.

items.name: Enable Game Mode
items.description: [Focus: FPS] Enables Windows Game Mode.

items.name: Disable Xbox Services
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Stops and disables Xbox services.

items.name: Disable Microsoft Edge
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Edge prelaunch/tab preloading via policy.

items.name: Disable Search Indexing
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Stops and disables Windows Search indexing service.

items.name: Optimize Windows Search
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables web/Bing search suggestions in Start search.

items.name: Disable Windows Updates
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Windows Update services and NoAutoUpdate policy.

items.name: Disable Scheduled Maintenance
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Automatic Maintenance scheduling.

items.name: Disable Scheduled Tasks
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables common telemetry scheduled tasks.

items.name: Disable Startup Delay For Apps
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Removes Windows startup delay for apps.

items.name: Disable Transparency Effects
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables transparency effects.

items.name: Disable Rounded Tooltips
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables balloon tips where possible.

items.name: Optimize Visual Settings
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Sets visual effects to performance profile.

items.name: Optimize Hung Apps
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Shortens hung app timeouts.

items.name: Priority Separation (Scheduler)
items.description: Controls Windows scheduler foreground boost and time slice via Win32PrioritySeparation. Balanced = stable feel; Latency = snappier input/foreground bias; FPS = more throughput/longer slices. Custom lets you enter the exact DWORD (decimal or hex like 0x26).

items.name: Configure Tsync Policy
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Sets kernel TscSyncPolicy (requires reboot on some systems).

items.name: Apply: Disable Hypervisor
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Hyper-V hypervisor launch. Requires reboot.
[Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Hyper-V hypervisor launch. Requires reboot.
items.name: Revert: Disable Hypervisor
Tweak Latency Tolerance
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Sets multimedia scheduling defaults for low latency.

items.name: Disable Device Power Saving
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables USB selective suspend.

items.name: Apply: Set Timer Resolution
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Requests 0.500ms timer resolution for the duration of the runner process (non-persistent). Prefer the persistent helper action.
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Requests 0.500ms timer resolution for the duration of the runner process (non-persistent). Prefer the persistent helper action.
items.name: Revert: Set Timer Resolution
Revert to Default
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Releases Falcon Optimizer's timer period request (best-effort).

steps.command: powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "try { Add-Type -TypeDefinition \"using System; using System.Runtime.InteropServices; public static class T { [DllImport(\\\"winmm.dll\\\")] public static extern uint timeBeginPeriod(uint uPeriod); [DllImport(\\\"winmm.dll\\\")] public static extern uint timeEndPeriod(uint uPeriod);} \"; [T]::timeEndPeriod(1) | Out-Null } catch { }"

items.name: Windows Dark Mode
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Toggles Windows dark/light mode (Apps + System). Restarts Explorer to apply immediately.

items.name: Apply: Disable Dynamic Tick
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables dynamic tick for more consistent timers (requires reboot).
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables dynamic tick for more consistent timers (requires reboot).
items.name: Revert: Disable Dynamic Tick
Apply: TSC Sync Policy (Enhanced)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Sets TSC sync policy to Enhanced (requires reboot).
[Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Sets TSC sync policy to Enhanced (requires reboot).
items.name: Revert: TSC Sync Policy (Enhanced)
Disable Power Throttling
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables Windows Power Throttling for better foreground performance.

items.name: Disable VBS (Virtualization Based Security)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables VBS. Security tradeoff; may require reboot.

items.name: Disable Memory Integrity (HVCI)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables HVCI/Memory Integrity. Security tradeoff; may require reboot.

items.name: Disable Windows Error Reporting Service
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables WER service to reduce background work.

items.name: Disable SysMain (Superfetch)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables SysMain to reduce background disk activity.

items.name: Disable Windows Search Indexer
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Windows Search indexing service.

items.name: Disable Diagnostics Tracking Service
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Connected User Experiences and Telemetry service.

items.name: Apply: Disable Scheduled Maintenance
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables automatic maintenance tasks that can run in background.
[Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables automatic maintenance tasks that can run in background.
items.name: Revert: Disable Scheduled Maintenance
Disable Background Apps
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables background apps capability for current user.

items.name: Disable Game DVR (Global)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables GameDVR/GameBar recording backend.

items.name: Apply: Disable Hibernation
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables hibernation (also disables Fast Startup).
[Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables hibernation (also disables Fast Startup).
items.name: Revert: Disable Hibernation
Disable Fast Startup
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Fast Startup.

items.name: Disable Transparency
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables transparency effects.

items.name: Disable Startup Delay
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Windows startup delay.

items.name: Apply: Disable NTFS Last Access Updates
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables last access timestamps on NTFS.
[Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables last access timestamps on NTFS.
items.name: Revert: Disable NTFS Last Access Updates
Disable Windows Tips
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables tips, tricks, and suggestions.

items.name: Restart Explorer (Apply UI Changes)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Restarts Windows Explorer to apply UI-related tweaks instantly.

items.name: Disable Windows Widgets
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Widgets/News and Interests.

items.name: Disable Cortana
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Cortana.

items.name: Reduce Telemetry (Policy)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Sets telemetry collection to minimum (policy-based).

items.name: Disable Windows Update Auto-Reboot
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Reduces forced update restarts during active hours.

items.name: Disable Spectre/Meltdown Mitigations
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Advanced: disables CPU vulnerability mitigations for performance. Security tradeoff; reboot required.

items.name: Disable Clipboard History
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables clipboard history & sync.

items.name: Start Timer Resolution Helper (0.500ms)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Starts a background helper that keeps 0.500ms timer resolution active until stopped.

items.name: Stop Timer Resolution Helper
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Stops the timer resolution helper and resets timer resolution request.

items.name: Disable MPO (Multiplane Overlay)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables DWM Multiplane Overlay via OverlayTestMode=5. Can fix stutter/flicker on some systems.

items.name: Disable Activity Feed
items.description: Disables the Windows activity feed.

items.name: Disable Advertising ID
items.description: Disables the Advertising ID used for personalized ads.

items.name: Disable All Ads
items.description: Reduces Windows ad/suggestion content where controlled by policy.

items.name: Disable CEIP
items.description: Disables Customer Experience Improvement Program participation.

items.name: Disable Compatibility Telemetry
items.description: Disables compatibility telemetry collectors where controlled by policy.

items.name: Disable Diagnostic Data Collection
items.description: Disables diagnostic data collection to the extent allowed by policy.

items.name: Disable Diagnostic Tracking
items.description: Stops and disables the Connected User Experiences and Telemetry service.

items.name: Disable Error Reporting And Advertising
items.description: Disables Windows Error Reporting and reduces related prompts.

items.name: Disable Feedback Hub
items.description: Disables feedback notifications/prompts.

items.name: Disable Help Experience Program
items.description: Reduces help experience telemetry where policy-controlled.

items.name: Disable Inventory Collector
items.description: Disables common inventory/compatibility scheduled tasks.

items.name: Disable Location Tracking
items.description: Disables Windows location services via policy.

items.name: Disable Remote Assistance
items.description: Disables Remote Assistance connections.

items.name: Disable Timeline Tracking
items.description: Disables Windows Timeline and activity upload.

items.name: Disable Advanced Telemetry
items.description: Applies stricter telemetry policy settings where possible.

items.name: Disable All Auto Loggers
items.description: Disables select ETW AutoLogger sessions used for diagnostics.

items.name: Apply: Disable Cimom Events
items.description: Disables the WMI Activity operational log (reduces WMI logging).
Disables the WMI Activity operational log (reduces WMI logging).
items.name: Revert: Disable Cimom Events
Apply: Disable Data Collection Hosts
items.description: Adds common telemetry hosts to the hosts file.
Adds common telemetry hosts to the hosts file.
items.name: Revert: Disable Data Collection Hosts
Add Control Panel Shortcut
items.description: Adds Control Panel shortcut to desktop.

items.name: Classic Alt+F4 Shutdown Menu
items.description: Enables the classic shutdown dialog (Alt+F4 on desktop).

items.name: Classic Right-click Menu
items.description: Enables the classic context menu on Windows 11 (requires Explorer restart).

items.name: Delete Default Power Plans
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Deletes default power plans (Balanced/Power saver/High performance).

items.name: Disable Automatic Installation Of Suggested Apps
items.description: Disables suggested app installs and consumer features.

items.name: Disable Rounded Tooltips
items.description: Disables balloon/tooltips where possible.

items.name: Disable Safe Search
items.description: Disables SafeSearch enforcement in Windows search (where applicable).

items.name: Disable Snap Layouts On Hover
items.description: Disables Windows 11 snap layouts hover popup.

items.name: Disable Start Menu App Suggestions
items.description: Disables Start menu suggestions and recommendations.

items.name: Disable Taskbar Chat
items.description: Hides Chat from the taskbar.

items.name: Disable Taskbar Transparency
items.description: Disables taskbar transparency effects.

items.name: Disable Widgets
items.description: Disables Widgets/News and Interests panel.

items.name: Disable Windows Tips
items.description: Disables Windows tips and suggestions notifications.

items.name: Enable Full Wallpaper Quality
items.description: Prevents wallpaper quality compression.

items.name: Enable Numlock On Startup
items.description: Enables NumLock at startup.

items.name: Remove Suggested Actions
items.description: Disables suggested actions (Win11).

items.name: Show Extensions In File Explorer
items.description: Shows file extensions in File Explorer.

items.name: Show Hidden Files In File Explorer
items.description: Shows hidden files in File Explorer.

items.name: Falcon Desktop Powerplan
items.description:
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Sets the active plan to High performance.
Mutually exclusive with other power plans.

items.name: Falcon Laptop Powerplan
items.description:
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Sets the active plan to Balanced.
Mutually exclusive with other power plans.

items.name: Apply: Set Ultimate Performance Power Plan
items.description:
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Activates Ultimate Performance power plan (creates if missing).
Mutually exclusive with other power plans.

[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Activates Ultimate Performance power plan (creates if missing).
Mutually exclusive with other power plans.
items.name: Revert: Set Ultimate Performance Power Plan
Apply: Disable USB Selective Suspend (AC/DC)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Prevents USB devices from entering selective suspend.
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Prevents USB devices from entering selective suspend.
items.name: Revert: Disable USB Selective Suspend (AC/DC)
Apply: Disable PCIe Link State Power Management (ASPM)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables ASPM for lower latency.
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables ASPM for lower latency.
items.name: Revert: Disable PCIe Link State Power Management (ASPM)
Apply: Processor Minimum State 100% (AC/DC)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Sets minimum processor state to 100%.
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Sets minimum processor state to 100%.
items.name: Revert: Processor Minimum State 100% (AC/DC)
Apply: Processor Maximum State 100% (AC/DC)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Sets maximum processor state to 100%.
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Sets maximum processor state to 100%.
items.name: Revert: Processor Maximum State 100% (AC/DC)
Apply: Disable Sleep (AC/DC)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables sleep timeouts.
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables sleep timeouts.
items.name: Revert: Disable Sleep (AC/DC)
Apply: Disable Hibernate Timeout (AC/DC)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Prevents automatic hibernate timeouts.
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Prevents automatic hibernate timeouts.
items.name: Revert: Disable Hibernate Timeout (AC/DC)
Disable Processor Idle States (Guided)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Sets idle disable via policy where applicable.

items.name: Disable Power Throttling (System)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables system-wide power throttling via PowerThrottlingOff. Helps prevent background throttling of games.

items.name: Basic Service Preset
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables common telemetry/location services while keeping Windows Update/Defender/Store enabled.

items.name: Advanced Service Preset
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Aggressive latency profile. Disables Windows Update/Store/Bluetooth/Xbox-related services. May break features.

items.name: Custom Service Configuration
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Opens Services management console so you can manually tune services.

items.name: Microsoft Edge AutoLaunch
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Microsoft Edge auto-launch/background startup.

items.name: Run Fortnite Config Folder
items.description: [Focus: FPS] Opens %LOCALAPPDATA%\FortniteGame\Saved\Config\WindowsClient.

items.name: Backup Fortnite Config (one-time)
items.description: [Focus: FPS] Copies your Fortnite config files to backups\fortnite.<timestamp>.

steps.command: $src=Join-Path $env:LOCALAPPDATA 'FortniteGame\Saved\Config\WindowsClient'; if(!(Test-Path $src)){throw 'Config folder not found';}; $dst=Join-Path (Resolve-Path .).Path ('backups\fortnite.'+(Get-Date -Format yyyyMMdd_HHmmss)); New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $dst | Out-Null; Copy-Item -Force -Recurse (Join-Path $src '*') $dst

items.name: Disable Fullscreen Optimizations (Fortnite)
items.description: [Focus: FPS] Sets compatibility layer to disable fullscreen optimizations for FortniteClient-Win64-Shipping.exe.

items.name: Set Fortnite Priority to High (while running)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] If Fortnite is running, sets process priority to High.

steps.command: $p=Get-Process FortniteClient-Win64-Shipping -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; if($p){$p.PriorityClass='High'} else {throw 'Fortnite is not running'}

items.name: Copy Command Line Args: -limitclientticks
items.description: [Focus: FPS] Copies -limitclientticks to clipboard (can help with hitches/packet issues on some systems).

items.name: Apply: High Definition Audio Controllers (MSI toggle)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Enables MSI (Message Signaled Interrupts) for detected devices in this class (requires reboot).

args: $devs=Get-PnpDevice -PresentOnly -Class 'MEDIA' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; foreach($d in $devs){$id=$d.InstanceId; $reg='HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Enum\'+$id+'\Device Parameters\Interrupt Management\MessageSignaledInterruptProperties'; New-Item -Path $reg -Force | Out-Null; New-ItemProperty -Path $reg -Name 'MSISupported' -PropertyType DWord -Value 1 -Force | Out-Null }

$devs=Get-PnpDevice -PresentOnly -Class 'MEDIA' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; foreach($d in $devs){$id=$d.InstanceId; $reg='HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Enum\'+$id+'\Device Parameters\Interrupt Management\MessageSignaledInterruptProperties'; Remove-ItemProperty -Path $reg -Name 'MSISupported' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }

Game Mode: Close OneDrive (runtime)
items.description: [Focus: FPS] Stops OneDrive process during gaming. Revert does not auto-restart; relaunch OneDrive if needed.

items.name: Game Mode: Close Xbox Game Bar (runtime)
items.description: [Focus: FPS] Stops GameBar processes during gaming.

items.name: Game Mode: Close Common Background Apps (runtime)
items.description: [Focus: FPS] Closes common background apps that steal focus/CPU/RAM (Discord, Chrome/Edge, Spotify, Steam/Epic helpers, OneDrive). Skips anything not running.

items.name: Disable Segment Heap
items.description: [Focus: FPS] Disables the global Segment Heap to reduce memory overhead and improve performance on some systems. Requires reboot.

items.name: Disable Platform Idle
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Prevents the CPU package from entering deep idle states for maximum responsiveness.

items.name: Processor Idle Disable
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables advanced processor idle states to keep cores fully active where supported.

items.name: Apply: Game Mode: Set Timer Resolution (0.5ms)
items.description: [Focus: Input Delay / Frame pacing] Starts a background timer request to improve scheduling granularity. Stop Game Mode will end it.

steps.command: Get-CimInstance Win32_Process -Filter "Name='powershell.exe'" | Where-Object { $_.CommandLine -like '*timer-helper.ps1*' } | ForEach-Object { Stop-Process -Id $_.ProcessId -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }

items.description: [Focus: Input Delay / Frame pacing] Starts a background timer request to improve scheduling granularity. Stop Game Mode will end it.
items.name: Revert: Game Mode: Set Timer Resolution (0.5ms)

steps.command: Get-CimInstance Win32_Process -Filter "Name='powershell.exe'" | Where-Object { $_.CommandLine -like '*timer-helper.ps1*' } | ForEach-Object { Stop-Process -Id $_.ProcessId -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }

items.name: Apply: Game Mode: Disable Xbox Game Bar (runtime)
items.description: [Focus: Stutter] Disables Game Bar captures & overlays via registry. Revert restores defaults.

steps.command: powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "New-Item -Path 'HKCU:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\GameBar' -Force | Out-Null; Set-ItemProperty -Path 'HKCU:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\GameBar' -Name 'AllowAutoGameMode' -Type DWord -Value 0 -Force; Set-ItemProperty -Path 'HKCU:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\GameBar' -Name 'ShowStartupPanel' -Type DWord -Value 0 -Force; Set-ItemProperty -Path 'HKCU:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\GameBar' -Name 'UseNexusForGameBarEnabled' -Type DWord -Value 0 -Force"

items.description: [Focus: Stutter] Disables Game Bar captures & overlays via registry. Revert restores defaults.

items.name: Generate BCD Report (current)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Saves bcdedit /enum {current} output to %ProgramData%\FalconOptimizer\Reports\bcd_current.txt and opens it.

steps.command: $dir=Join-Path $env:ProgramData 'FalconOptimizer\Reports'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $dir | Out-Null; bcdedit /enum {current} | Out-File -Encoding utf8 (Join-Path $dir 'bcd_current.txt');

items.name: Reset Common Timer Flags (deletevalue)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Deletes common timer-related BCDEdit values from {current}: disabledynamictick, useplatformclock, useplatformtick, tscsyncpolicy.

items.name: Run Safe Mode Recovery Guide
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Reference guide for entering Safe Mode if a boot tweak causes issues.

items.name: Check BitLocker Status
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Shows BitLocker protection status (important before boot config changes).

items.name: Report QPC/Timer Source (basic)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Writes a basic timer report to %ProgramData%\FalconOptimizer\Reports\timer_report.txt and opens it.

steps.command: $dir=Join-Path $env:ProgramData 'FalconOptimizer\Reports'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $dir | Out-Null; $out=Join-Path $dir 'timer_report.txt'; "Date: $(Get-Date)" | Out-File -Encoding utf8 $out; "WinVer: $([Environment]::OSVersion.VersionString)" | Add-Content $out; bcdedit /enum {current} | Add-Content $out; w32tm /query /configuration 2>$null | Add-Content $out;

items.name: Engine/Game: Disable Game Bar + DVR (global)
items.description: Disables Xbox Game Bar and GameDVR capture features to reduce background hooks/overlays.

items.name: Engine/Game: Disable Fullscreen Optimizations (global policy)
items.description: Disables Fullscreen Optimizations system-wide for fewer presentation mode surprises.

items.name: Engine/Game: Disable Pointer Precision (mouse accel off)
items.description: Turns off Windows enhanced pointer precision for consistent aim.

items.name: Engine/Game: Disable Xbox services (safe stop)
items.description: Stops Xbox-related services (can reduce background activity if you don't use Xbox features).

items.name: Engine/Game: Disable background apps (per-user)
items.description: Blocks background app execution for UWP apps to reduce background wakeups.

items.name: Engine/Game: Disable Windows tips/suggestions
items.description: Reduces OS suggestion content and background fetching.

items.name: Engine/Game: Disable animations (performance UI)
items.description: Reduces UI animation overhead.

items.name: Engine/Game: Enable Game Mode
items.description: Enables Windows Game Mode scheduler behavior.

items.name: Engine/Game: Disable OneDrive startup (per-user)
items.description: Prevents OneDrive from auto-starting (less background).

items.name: Fortnite Config Folder (WindowsClient)
items.description: [Focus: FPS] Opens %LOCALAPPDATA%\FortniteGame\Saved\Config\WindowsClient so you can edit GameUserSettings.ini and Engine.ini for fine-tuned competitive settings.

items.name: Set Overwatch Priority to High (while running)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] If the game process is running, sets its process priority to High for this Windows session.

steps.command: $p=Get-Process Overwatch -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; if($p){$p.PriorityClass='High'} else {throw 'Overwatch is not running'}

items.name: Input Tuning (Mouse / Controller / Polling)
items.description:
[Focus: input delay, consistency]
Mouse
- Turn off Windows mouse acceleration (Enhance Pointer Precision).
- Use a stable DPI + ingame sens. Avoid constant sens changes.
- Polling rate: 1000Hz is standard. Higher rates can help, but may increase CPU overhead on some rigstest for microstutter. Controller
- Wired is usually lowest-latency.
- Reduce deadzones as low as stable.
- Disable extra smoothing/filters if the game offers it. Check
- If input feels floaty only when FPS drops, its a performance issue, not a mouse setting.

items.name: Overlay + Background App KillList (Real FPS Gains)
items.description:
[Focus: real FPS gains]
High-impact background offenders:
- RGB suites (iCUE, Armoury Crate, Mystic Light)
- Browsers with video tabs
- Clip recorders you dont need
- Cloud sync during play (OneDrive/Dropbox active sync)
- Updaters running in the background Competitive habit
- Before ranked: close everything unnecessary, then launch the game fresh. Why this matters
- CPU spikes and disk spikes cause hitching more than most registry tweaks.

items.name: Input Tuning (Mouse / Controller / Polling)
items.description:
[Focus: input delay, consistency]
Mouse
- Turn off Windows mouse acceleration (Enhance Pointer Precision).
- Use a stable DPI + ingame sens. Avoid constant sens changes.
- Polling rate: 1000Hz is standard. Higher rates can help, but may increase CPU overhead on some rigstest for microstutter. Controller
- Wired is usually lowest-latency.
- Reduce deadzones as low as stable.
- Disable extra smoothing/filters if the game offers it. Check
- If input feels floaty only when FPS drops, its a performance issue, not a mouse setting.

items.name: Reset to default (Fortnite 1920x1080)
items.description: [Default] Writes 1920x1080 native resolution to GameUserSettings.ini.

steps.command: $path = Join-Path $env:LOCALAPPDATA 'FortniteGame\Saved\Config\WindowsClient\GameUserSettings.ini'; if (!(Test-Path $path)) { Write-Output 'GameUserSettings.ini not found.'; return } $content = Get-Content $path; $kv = @{ 'ResolutionSizeX'='1920'; 'ResolutionSizeY'='1080'; 'LastUserConfirmedResolutionSizeX'='1920'; 'LastUserConfirmedResolutionSizeY'='1080'; 'DesiredScreenWidth'='1920'; 'DesiredScreenHeight'='1080'; 'LastUserConfirmedDesiredScreenWidth'='1920'; 'LastUserConfirmedDesiredScreenHeight'='1080'; 'FullscreenMode'='0' }; foreach($k in $kv.Keys){ $pattern = '^' + $k + '='; $replacement = $k + '=' + $kv[$k]; $found = $false; $content = $content | ForEach-Object { if ($_ -like ($k + '=*')) { $found = $true; $replacement } else { $_ } }; if (-not $found) { $content += $replacement } } Set-Content -Path $path -Value $content -Encoding ASCII; Write-Output 'Applied 1920x1080 stretched for Fortnite.'

items.name: Method 2  Config-only Fortnite stretch
items.description: [Focus: Automation] Explains that the Fortnite presets here directly edit GameUserSettings.ini to force resolution, which is safer than random config packs.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
These presets edit %LOCALAPPDATA%/FortniteGame/Saved/Config/WindowsClient/GameUserSettings.ini with clean, reversible key writes instead of replacing the entire file.
"@

items.name: Open Valorant config folder
items.description: [Focus: Control] Opens the Valorant configuration folder so you can inspect or adjust video/resolution settings directly.

items.name: Open Fortnite GameUserSettings.ini
items.description: [Focus: Advanced] Opens the Fortnite GameUserSettings.ini file so you can create a fully custom stretched resolution.

items.name: How to build a custom stretch (Fortnite)
items.description: [Focus: Guide] Step-by-step instructions for manually creating any custom stretched resolution in Fortnite.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
CUSTOM FORTNITE STRETCH (MANUAL):
- Close Fortnite before editing.
- Open GameUserSettings.ini (use the button above or open it from %LOCALAPPDATA%\FortniteGame...).
- Find and edit ALL of these keys to your target resolution (e.g. 1520x1080):
  * ResolutionSizeX / ResolutionSizeY
  * LastUserConfirmedResolutionSizeX / Y
  * DesiredScreenWidth / DesiredScreenHeight
  * LastUserConfirmedDesiredScreenWidth / Height
- Set FullscreenMode=0 for true fullscreen.
- Save the file, then launch Fortnite and use Fullscreen in video settings.
"@

items.name: Open CS2 config folder
items.description: [Focus: Control] Tries to open the most common Counter-Strike 2 config folder so you can adjust video / resolution settings or autoexec files yourself.

items.name: CS2 stretch  methods overview
items.description: [Focus: Info] Explains common Counter-Strike 2 stretching methods and what they do for model width and visibility.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
CS2 STRETCH OVERVIEW:
- Use your GPU control panel (NVIDIA, AMD, Intel) to pick Full-panel scaling or Keep aspect ratio.
- In CS2 video settings, you can pick:
  * 4:3 or 5:4 resolution for classic stretched models.
  * 16:9 native if you want less distortion but cleaner image.
- For true stretch:
  * Set GPU scaling to Full-panel.
  * Pick 4:3 res like 1280x960 or 1024x768.
  * Use Fullscreen or Exclusive Fullscreen where available.
- If you use autoexec:
  * Keep your -w / -h launch options in sync with your chosen stretch res.
  * Avoid random config packs from the internet; use your own settings.
"@

steps.command: Set-Clipboard -Value "-w 1440 -h 900 -fullscreen"; Write-Output "Copied launch options for Any Game: -w 1440 -h 900 -fullscreen"

items.name: 1656x1080 (Fortnite)
items.description: [Focus: FPS/Visibility] Writes 1656x1080 to GameUserSettings.ini (backup saved). Popular/pro-style: Popular comp 16:10-ish.

steps.command: $path = Join-Path $env:LOCALAPPDATA 'FortniteGame\Saved\Config\WindowsClient\GameUserSettings.ini'; if (!(Test-Path $path)) { Write-Output 'GameUserSettings.ini not found.'; return } $bakDir = Join-Path $env:ProgramData 'FalconOptimizer\stretch_backups'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $bakDir | Out-Null; $bak = Join-Path $bakDir ('GameUserSettings_' + (Get-Date).ToString('yyyyMMdd_HHmmss') + '.ini'); Copy-Item $path $bak -Force; $content = Get-Content $path; $kv = @{ 'ResolutionSizeX'='1656'; 'ResolutionSizeY'='1080'; 'LastUserConfirmedResolutionSizeX'='1656'; 'LastUserConfirmedResolutionSizeY'='1080'; 'DesiredScreenWidth'='1656'; 'DesiredScreenHeight'='1080'; 'LastUserConfirmedDesiredScreenWidth'='1656'; 'LastUserConfirmedDesiredScreenHeight'='1080'; 'FullscreenMode'='0' }; foreach($k in $kv.Keys){ $replacement = $k + '=' + $kv[$k]; $found = $false; $content = $content | ForEach-Object { if ($_ -like ($k + '=*')) { $found = $true; $replacement } else { $_ } }; if (-not $found) { $content += $replacement } } Set-Content -Path $path -Value $content -Encoding ASCII; Write-Output 'Applied 1656x1080 stretched for Fortnite.'; Write-Output ('Backup: ' + $bak)

items.name: Scan Audio Engine & Devices
items.description: [Analyzer] Lists audio devices and MMDevices render endpoints to help you see what the OS is using.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
Scan is read-only and requires no revert.
"@

items.name: Apply: Disable Global Audio Enhancements & System Sounds
items.description: [Focus: Stutter / Latency] Sets DisableAudioEnhancements=1 (global) and turns off the system sound scheme to reduce audio engine overhead and distractions.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
Re-enabling enhancements/system sounds requires manually restoring your previous sound scheme and enhancement settings.
"@

items.description: [Focus: Stutter / Latency] Sets DisableAudioEnhancements=1 (global) and turns off the system sound scheme to reduce audio engine overhead and distractions.
items.name: Revert: Disable Global Audio Enhancements & System Sounds

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
Re-enabling enhancements/system sounds requires manually restoring your previous sound scheme and enhancement settings.
"@

items.name: Apply: Disable audio enhancements (endpoint)
items.description: Disables Windows audio enhancements to reduce processing.

steps.command:
$k = "HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Multimedia\Audio"
New-Item -Force -Path $k | Out-Null
New-ItemProperty -Path $k -Name "DisableAudioEnhancements" -Value 1 -PropertyType DWord -Force | Out-Null
Write-Output "DisableAudioEnhancements set."

items.description: Disables Windows audio enhancements to reduce processing.
items.name: Revert: Disable audio enhancements (endpoint)
Apply: Restart Windows Audio services
items.description: Restarts Audiosrv/AudioEndpointBuilder.

steps.command: Restart-Service Audiosrv -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Restart-Service AudioEndpointBuilder -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Write-Output 'Audio services restarted.'

items.description: Restarts Audiosrv/AudioEndpointBuilder.
items.name: Revert: Restart Windows Audio services
DPC / ISR Latency Snapshot
items.description: [Analyzer] Samples % DPC Time and % Interrupt Time over ~30 seconds and prints basic stats.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
DPC snapshot is read-only and needs no revert.
"@

items.name: Apply: Disable Dynamic Tick
items.description: May reduce latency spikes; can increase idle power.
May reduce latency spikes; can increase idle power.
items.name: Revert: Disable Dynamic Tick
Apply: Use Platform Tick
items.description: Forces platform tick; only helps on some systems.
Forces platform tick; only helps on some systems.
items.name: Revert: Use Platform Tick
Apply: TSC Sync Policy Enhanced
items.description: May improve timer stability on some platforms.
May improve timer stability on some platforms.
items.name: Revert: TSC Sync Policy Enhanced
Apply: Platform Clock True
items.description: HPET/platform clock forcing (often worse; use carefully).
HPET/platform clock forcing (often worse; use carefully).
items.name: Revert: Platform Clock True
Disable USB Selective Suspend
items.description: Disables USB selective suspend to reduce input latency spikes.

items.name: Auto-Detect Games & Recommend Falcon Setup
items.description: [Analyzer] Scans for popular competitive titles (Fortnite, Valorant, CS2, Apex, etc.) and prints per-game Falcon module recommendations.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
Game auto-detect is read-only and needs no revert.
"@

items.name: Disable MPO
items.description: Disables MPO via DWM OverlayTestMode.

items.name: Disable All Notifications
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables toast notifications.

items.name: Disable Bluetooth Services
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Stops and disables Bluetooth service.

items.name: Disable Driver Searching
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Prevents Windows from searching Windows Update for drivers.

items.name: Disable GameDVR
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Xbox Game Bar capture/GameDVR.

items.name: Disable Xbox Services
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Stops and disables Xbox services.

items.name: Disable Microsoft Edge
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Edge prelaunch/tab preloading via policy.

items.name: Disable Search Indexing
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Stops and disables Windows Search indexing service.

items.name: Disable Windows Updates
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Windows Update services and NoAutoUpdate policy.

items.name: Disable Scheduled Maintenance
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Automatic Maintenance scheduling.

items.name: Disable Scheduled Tasks
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables common telemetry scheduled tasks.

items.name: Optimize Hung Apps
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Shortens hung app timeouts.

items.name: Set Windows 32 Priority Separation
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Sets Win32PrioritySeparation foreground scheduling.

items.name: Configure Tsync Policy
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Sets kernel TscSyncPolicy (requires reboot on some systems).

items.name: Apply: Disable Hypervisor
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Hyper-V hypervisor launch. Requires reboot.
[Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Hyper-V hypervisor launch. Requires reboot.
items.name: Revert: Disable Hypervisor
Tweak Latency Tolerance
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Sets multimedia scheduling defaults for low latency.

items.name: Disable Device Power Saving
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables USB selective suspend.

items.name: Apply: Set Timer Resolution
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Requests 0.500ms timer resolution for the duration of the runner process (non-persistent). Prefer the persistent helper action.
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Requests 0.500ms timer resolution for the duration of the runner process (non-persistent). Prefer the persistent helper action.
items.name: Revert: Set Timer Resolution
Apply: Disable Dynamic Tick
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables dynamic tick for more consistent timers (requires reboot).
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables dynamic tick for more consistent timers (requires reboot).
items.name: Revert: Disable Dynamic Tick
Apply: TSC Sync Policy (Enhanced)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Sets TSC sync policy to Enhanced (requires reboot).
[Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Sets TSC sync policy to Enhanced (requires reboot).
items.name: Revert: TSC Sync Policy (Enhanced)
Disable Power Throttling
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables Windows Power Throttling for better foreground performance.

items.name: Disable Windows Error Reporting Service
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables WER service to reduce background work.

items.name: Disable SysMain (Superfetch)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables SysMain to reduce background disk activity.

items.name: Disable Windows Search Indexer
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Windows Search indexing service.

items.name: Disable Diagnostics Tracking Service
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Connected User Experiences and Telemetry service.

items.name: Apply: Disable Scheduled Maintenance
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables automatic maintenance tasks that can run in background.
[Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables automatic maintenance tasks that can run in background.
items.name: Revert: Disable Scheduled Maintenance
Apply: Disable Hibernation
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables hibernation (also disables Fast Startup).
[Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables hibernation (also disables Fast Startup).
items.name: Revert: Disable Hibernation
Disable Fast Startup
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Fast Startup.

items.name: Reduce Telemetry (Policy)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Sets telemetry collection to minimum (policy-based).

items.name: Disable Windows Update Auto-Reboot
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Reduces forced update restarts during active hours.

items.name: Start Timer Resolution Helper (0.500ms)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Starts a background helper that keeps 0.500ms timer resolution active until stopped.

items.name: Disable MPO (Multiplane Overlay)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables DWM Multiplane Overlay via OverlayTestMode=5. Can fix stutter/flicker on some systems.

items.name: Disable Compatibility Telemetry
items.description: Disables compatibility telemetry collectors where controlled by policy.

items.name: Disable Diagnostic Data Collection
items.description: Disables diagnostic data collection to the extent allowed by policy.

items.name: Disable Diagnostic Tracking
items.description: Stops and disables the Connected User Experiences and Telemetry service.

items.name: Disable Location Tracking
items.description: Disables Windows location services via policy.

items.name: Disable Advanced Telemetry
items.description: Applies stricter telemetry policy settings where possible.

items.name: Disable All Auto Loggers
items.description: Disables select ETW AutoLogger sessions used for diagnostics.

items.name: Apply: Disable Cimom Events
items.description: Disables the WMI Activity operational log (reduces WMI logging).
Disables the WMI Activity operational log (reduces WMI logging).

Apply: Disable Data Collection Hosts

Adds common telemetry hosts to the hosts file.
items.name: Revert: Disable Data Collection Hosts
Classic Right-click Menu

items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Deletes default power plans (Balanced/Power saver/High performance).

items.name: Disable Widgets
items.description: Disables Widgets/News and Interests panel.

items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables system-wide power throttling via PowerThrottlingOff. Helps prevent background throttling of games.

items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables dynamic tick to reduce timer coalescing (requires reboot).
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables dynamic tick to reduce timer coalescing (requires reboot).

items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables Windows power throttling for background tasks.

items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Modern Standby (S0) by setting CsEnabled=0 (requires reboot).

items.name: Set Energy Performance Preference
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Sets Energy Performance Preference (EPP) to 0 (max performance) on AC.

items.name: Set Minimum And Maximum Processor State
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Sets Min/Max processor state to 100% on AC in the current power plan.

items.name: Disable Eventprocessor
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Sets a registry flag to disable EventProcessor behavior (requires reboot).

items.name: Set Kernel Worker Threads
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Sets additional kernel worker threads (requires reboot).

items.name: Apply: Disable Core Parking (PowerCfg)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables core parking by setting min cores to 100%.
[Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables core parking by setting min cores to 100%.
items.name: Revert: Disable Core Parking (PowerCfg)
Disable CPU Idle Disable (Advanced)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Enables high-performance behavior by disabling certain idle behaviors.

items.name: MMCSS Games Priority Boost
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Boosts MMCSS Games task priority.

items.name: System Responsiveness 0%
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Sets system responsiveness to 0% for gaming.

items.name: Foreground Boost (Win32PrioritySeparation)
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Adjusts foreground scheduling priority boost.

items.name: Apply: Disable Memory Compression
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Windows memory compression.
[Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Windows memory compression.
items.name: Revert: Disable Memory Compression
Disable SysMain (Superfetch)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Stops and disables SysMain.

items.name: Disable Superfetch
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Superfetch behaviour.

items.name: Apply: Disable Page Combining
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables memory page combining.
[Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables memory page combining.
items.name: Revert: Disable Page Combining
Disable Paging Executive
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Keeps kernel drivers in RAM.

items.name: Apply: Disable Page Combining
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables memory page combining.
[Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables memory page combining.
items.name: Revert: Disable Page Combining
Disable Paging Executive
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Keeps kernel drivers in RAM.

items.name: Disable USB Selective Suspend
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables USB selective suspend (can reduce input dropouts).

items.name: Apply: Disable USB Power Saving
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables USB power saving features.

steps.command: powercfg -SETACVALUEINDEX SCHEME_CURRENT SUB_USB USBSELECTIVE 0 | Out-Null; powercfg -S SCHEME_CURRENT | Out-Null
powercfg -SETACVALUEINDEX SCHEME_CURRENT SUB_USB USBSELECTIVE 1 | Out-Null; powercfg -S SCHEME_CURRENT | Out-Null

items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables USB power saving features.
items.name: Revert: Disable USB Power Saving

steps.command: powercfg -SETACVALUEINDEX SCHEME_CURRENT SUB_USB USBSELECTIVE 1 | Out-Null; powercfg -S SCHEME_CURRENT | Out-Null

items.name: Disable Bluetooth Power Saving
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Reduces Bluetooth power saving behaviors.

items.name: Disable Xbox Controller Services
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Xbox services that can add background load.

items.name: Disable Touch Keyboard and Handwriting Service
items.description: [Focus: Latency / Input Delay] Disables tablet input service (if not used).

items.name: Apply: Disable Hibernate
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables hibernation and removes hiberfil.sys (frees disk space).
[Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables hibernation and removes hiberfil.sys (frees disk space).
items.name: Revert: Disable Hibernate
Disable NTFS Compression on C: (Guided)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Guided: removes NTFS compression flag from C: (may take time).

items.name: Disable Diagnostics Loggers
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables some diagnostic loggers for disk/IO.

items.name: Disable USN Journal on C: (one-time)
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Deletes and disables USN journal on C: (Windows may recreate).

items.name: Basic Service Preset
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables common telemetry/location services while keeping Windows Update/Defender/Store enabled.

items.name: Microsoft Edge AutoLaunch
items.description: [Focus: FPS, Latency / Input Delay] Disables Microsoft Edge auto-launch/background startup.

items.name: Run Autoruns (bundled)
items.description: Launches Autoruns if you place it in tools/autoruns/ as Autoruns64.exe. Put the file in the opened folder with the expected name, then re-run.

items.name: Install/Run BCU (bundled)
items.description: Runs BCU installer if you place it in tools/bcu/ as BCUninstallerSetup.exe. Put the file in the opened folder with the expected name, then re-run.

items.name: Install Open-Shell (bundled)
items.description: Runs Open-Shell installer if you place it in tools/open-shell/ as OpenShellSetup.exe. Put the file in the opened folder with the expected name, then re-run.

items.name: Run DDU folder (bundled)
items.description: Opens and runs DDU if you place it in tools/ddu/ as DDU.exe. Put the file in the opened folder with the expected name, then re-run.

items.name: Run Defender Control (bundled)
items.description: Runs DefenderControl if you place it in tools/defender-control/ as DefenderControl.exe. Put the file in the opened folder with the expected name, then re-run.

items.name: Disable Xbox Game Bar (registry)
items.description: [Hardcore] Disables Game Bar UI and hotkeys (Win+G) via registry for current user.

steps.command:
reg add "HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\GameBar" /v AllowAutoGameMode /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f | Out-Null
reg add "HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\GameBar" /v ShowStartupPanel /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f | Out-Null
reg add "HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\GameBar" /v UseNexusForGameBarEnabled /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f | Out-Null
reg add "HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\GameDVR" /v AppCaptureEnabled /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f | Out-Null
Write-Output "Disabled Xbox Game Bar UI/hotkeys for current user."

reg add "HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\GameBar" /v UseNexusForGameBarEnabled /t REG_DWORD /d 1 /f | Out-Null
reg add "HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\GameDVR" /v AppCaptureEnabled /t REG_DWORD /d 1 /f | Out-Null
Write-Output "Reverted Game Bar keys (best-effort)."

items.name: Disable Game DVR / Captures (policy)
items.description: [Hardcore] Disables background captures and DVR via policy keys (best-effort).

steps.command:
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\GameDVR" /v AllowGameDVR /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f | Out-Null
reg add "HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\GameDVR" /v GameDVR_Enabled /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f | Out-Null
Write-Output "Disabled Game DVR / Captures policy."

reg delete "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\GameDVR" /v AllowGameDVR /f 2>$null
reg add "HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\GameDVR" /v GameDVR_Enabled /t REG_DWORD /d 1 /f | Out-Null
Write-Output "Reverted Game DVR policy (best-effort)."

items.name: Disable Windows Captures UI (Captures)
items.description: [Hardcore] Disables Windows capture features for current user.

steps.command:
reg add "HKCU\System\GameConfigStore" /v GameDVR_Enabled /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f | Out-Null
reg add "HKCU\System\GameConfigStore" /v GameDVR_FSEBehaviorMode /t REG_DWORD /d 2 /f | Out-Null
Write-Output "Disabled capture UI toggles under GameConfigStore."

reg add "HKCU\System\GameConfigStore" /v GameDVR_Enabled /t REG_DWORD /d 1 /f | Out-Null
reg add "HKCU\System\GameConfigStore" /v GameDVR_FSEBehaviorMode /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f | Out-Null
Write-Output "Reverted capture UI toggles (best-effort)."

items.name: Disable Focus Assist / notifications while gaming
items.description: [Hardcore] Reduces popups/notifications that can steal focus during games.

steps.command:
reg add "HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Notifications\Settings" /v NOC_GLOBAL_SETTING_TOASTS_ENABLED /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f | Out-Null
Write-Output "Disabled toast notifications (current user)."

reg add "HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Notifications\Settings" /v NOC_GLOBAL_SETTING_TOASTS_ENABLED /t REG_DWORD /d 1 /f | Out-Null
Write-Output "Re-enabled toast notifications (current user)."

items.name: Disable background apps (HKCU)
items.description: [Hardcore] Disables background app permissions for current user (reduces background activity).

steps.command:
reg add "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\BackgroundAccessApplications" /v GlobalUserDisabled /t REG_DWORD /d 1 /f | Out-Null
Write-Output "Background apps disabled for current user."

reg add "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\BackgroundAccessApplications" /v GlobalUserDisabled /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f | Out-Null
Write-Output "Background apps enabled for current user."

items.name: Disable Windows Widgets
items.description: [Hardcore] Disables Widgets taskbar component (reduces background webview activity).

steps.command:
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Dsh" /v AllowNewsAndInterests /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f | Out-Null
Write-Output "Widgets/News disabled (policy)."

reg delete "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Dsh" /v AllowNewsAndInterests /f 2>$null
Write-Output "Widgets/News policy removed (best-effort)."

items.name: Disable search box suggestions
items.description: [Hardcore] Reduces Search UI suggestions/background web lookups.

steps.command:
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Windows Search" /v DisableWebSearch /t REG_DWORD /d 1 /f | Out-Null
reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Windows Search" /v ConnectedSearchUseWeb /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f | Out-Null
Write-Output "Web search disabled (policy)."

reg delete "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Windows Search" /v DisableWebSearch /f 2>$null
reg delete "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Windows Search" /v ConnectedSearchUseWeb /f 2>$null
Write-Output "Web search policy removed (best-effort)."

items.name: Disable Start suggestions
items.description: [Hardcore] Disables Start menu suggestions/recommendations.

steps.command:
reg add "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\ContentDeliveryManager" /v SystemPaneSuggestionsEnabled /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f | Out-Null
Write-Output "Start suggestions disabled."

items.name: Disable lock screen tips/spotlight

reg add "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\ContentDeliveryManager" /v RotatingLockScreenOverlayEnabled /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f | Out-Null

items.name: Apply: Force Active Cooling Policy (AC)
items.description: [Focus: Stability] Sets the AC SYSTEM_COOLING_POLICY for the current power plan to Active, favoring fan usage over CPU frequency throttling.

steps.command:
Write-Output "=== FALCON THERMAL ENGINE: SET ACTIVE COOLING POLICY ==="
Write-Output ""
Write-Output "Setting system cooling policy to 'Active' on AC for the current power scheme."
Write-Output "This asks Windows to favor fan speed over CPU frequency throttling under load."
Write-Output ""

$scheme = "SCHEME_CURRENT"
$sub_processor = "SUB_PROCESSOR"
$cool_guid = "94D3A615-A899-4AC5-AE2B-E4D8F634367F" # SYSTEM_COOLING_POLICY

try {
  powercfg /SETACVALUEINDEX $scheme $sub_processor $cool_guid 0 2>$null
  Write-Output "Set AC SYSTEM_COOLING_POLICY to Active (0)."
  powercfg /SETACTIVE $scheme 2>$null
  Write-Output "Re-activated current power scheme so changes take effect."
} catch {
  Write-Output ("Failed to set cooling policy: {0}" -f $_.Exception.Message)
}

Write-Output ""
Write-Output "Note: Some OEM power utilities may override this setting."
Write-Output "=== END OF ACTIVE COOLING POLICY APPLY ==="

Write-Output @"
To revert cooling policy, set SYSTEM_COOLING_POLICY back to 'Passive' or restore your power plan defaults via powercfg or OEM tool.
"@

Write-Output @"

items.name: Apply: Cooling Preset: Silent / Low Noise
items.description: Active cooling + slightly reduced CPU max state to reduce heat/noise spikes.

steps.command:
Write-Output "Applying SILENT cooling preset..."
powercfg -setacvalueindex SCHEME_CURRENT SUB_PROCESSOR 94D3A615-A899-4AC5-AE2B-E4D8F634367F 0 | Out-Null
powercfg -setdcvalueindex SCHEME_CURRENT SUB_PROCESSOR 94D3A615-A899-4AC5-AE2B-E4D8F634367F 0 | Out-Null
powercfg -setacvalueindex SCHEME_CURRENT SUB_PROCESSOR PROCTHROTTLEMAX 97 | Out-Null
powercfg -setdcvalueindex SCHEME_CURRENT SUB_PROCESSOR PROCTHROTTLEMAX 95 | Out-Null
powercfg -setacvalueindex SCHEME_CURRENT SUB_PROCESSOR PROCTHROTTLEMIN 5 | Out-Null
powercfg -setdcvalueindex SCHEME_CURRENT SUB_PROCESSOR PROCTHROTTLEMIN 5 | Out-Null
powercfg -SetActive SCHEME_CURRENT | Out-Null
Write-Output "Done."

Write-Output "Reverting SILENT preset..."
powercfg -setacvalueindex SCHEME_CURRENT SUB_PROCESSOR PROCTHROTTLEMAX 100 | Out-Null
powercfg -setdcvalueindex SCHEME_CURRENT SUB_PROCESSOR PROCTHROTTLEMAX 100 | Out-Null
powercfg -SetActive SCHEME_CURRENT | Out-Null
Write-Output "Done."
